article.title: Document Plan for the Ubuntu Documentation Style Guide

note.para: If you would like to make changes to this document please go to StyleGuideDiscussion first. The wiki moin for this plan is generated automatically from styleguide-plan.xml in the Docteam's Subversion repository.

sect1.title: Purpose of the Style Guide

listitem.para: To create a consistent style across all documents.
To create a consistent use of terminology across all documents.
To highlight common problems in the use of the English language, and to provide solutions.
To help writers write for an international audience, including how to write for translation.
To help writers and editors select the appropriate DocBook markup.

sect1.para: The Ubuntu documentation team needs its own style guide because Ubuntu is unique. Ubuntu is Linux + GNU + Debian + (GNOME and KDE) + the Ubuntu philosophy. No style guide covers the entire spectrum of Ubuntu components.

sect1.title: Audience Profile
sect1.para: The audience for the Ubuntu Documentation Style guide is the Ubuntu Documentation Team. Although the team's members come from a variety of cultures and backgrounds, they have something in common; the desire to produce high quality documentation.
Members of the team are competent writers in the English language, although English is not the first language for many of them.

sect1.title: Scope of the Style Guide
sect1.para: The style guide will contain two main types of information:

listitem.para: Topics and situations applicable to Ubuntu documentation but not covered in other style guides.
Information found in other style guides, but repeated in the Ubuntu style guide. The purpose of the repeated information is to provide quicker access to important information.
The Need for an Ubuntu Documentation Style Guide
Grammar, Punctuation, Spelling, Style, and Word Usage

sect2.title: Planning Phase
sect2.para: Planning begins on April 20, 2005. During the planning phase, the style guide's structure is created with input from the Ubuntu Documentation Team and with reference to existing style guides. The planning phase ends on May 31.

listitem.para: an announcement on the ubuntu-doc mailing list
creation of the StyleGuidePlan wiki page
creation of the StyleGuideDiscussion wiki page
creation of the style guide directory structure and skeleton DocBook files in the Subversion repository

sect2.para: By May 31, the style guide structure will be finalized. After May 31, no structural changes will be made to the style guide unless the proposed change is first discussed on the StyleGuideDiscussion wiki page or on the ubuntu-doc list, and agreed to by participants in the discussion. Non-participation equals approval.

sect2.title: Writing and Development Phase
sect2.para: The writing phase starts on June 1, 2005 and ends on July 31, 2005.

sect2.title: Release
sect2.para: The style guide will be released on August 1, 2005. This will give editors two months before Breezy Badger is released to review the documentation and bring it into conformance with the style guide.

The style guide content will be frozen from August 1 until after the Breezy Badger release sometime in October 2005. The structure and content of the style guide must be fairly stable, otherwise there is a significant risk that it will be ignored by writers and editors.

sect2.title: Post-release Writing and Development Cycle
sect2.para: The writing and development cycle will closely follow the Ubuntu release cycle. Work on the next version of the style guide will start on the day after Breezy is released, and will continue until two months before the next release.

sect1.title: Version Numbering
sect1.para: The version will have two parts and will be in the form n.n. The first n is the major release, and the second n is the minor release.

The initial release (during the first writing and development phase) will be 0.1. On August 1 (the end of the intial writing and development phase) the number becomes 1.0 and will stay at 1.0 until after Breezy is released.

sect1.title: Estimated Page and Graphic Counts
sect1.para: There may be a couple of screen captures used to illustrate GUI terms.
The initial release will probably be no more than 25 pages when printed.
